abstract: Standing Rock Sioux Tribe's efforts to block Dakota Access oil pipeline from being built by Energy Transfer Partners just north of its reservation in North Dakota has drawn thousands of protesters and stirred up new environmental movement for dozens of Native American tribes across country; efforts recall for many cultural catastrophe wrought by building of Oahe Dam along Missouri River by Army Corps of Engineers in 1958, which displaced hundreds of Native American families and flooded their lands.
lead_paragraph: Some of the Native Americans protesting in North Dakota speak of lost lands and broken treaties. They hope this fight will have a happier outcome.
snippet: Some of the Native Americans protesting in North Dakota speak of lost lands and broken treaties. They hope this fight will have a happier outcome....

headline.main: ‘I Want to Win Someday’: Tribes Make Stand Against Pipeline
headline.print_headline: ‘I Want to Win Someday’: Tribes Make Stand Against Pipeline
